text:
TITLE:
      Physical Activity for Advanced Stage Cancer Patients
SUMMARY:
      The purpose of this study is to understand if a home-based physical activity program can
      improve symptoms and physical function among patients with advanced stage cancer.
DETAILED DESCRIPTION:
      This program includes use of the Nintendo Wii Fit™Plus (Wii Fit) and home visits by a nurse.
      The same nurse will attend all of the visits.
ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA:
      Inclusion Criteria:
          -  have stage III or IV cancer diagnosis
          -  able to understand English
          -  have a Karnofsky Performance Status (KPS) score of 60% (able to care for most of the
             personal needs)
          -  have fatigue and/or two other target symptoms
          -  have been cleared by their provider to engage low to moderate intensity physical
             activities
        Exclusion Criteria:
          -  are hospitalized
          -  have lesion or metastasis of bone
          -  have a cardiac pacemaker
          -  have a history of seizure or loss of consciousness
          -  have been using a Wii Fit
          -  diagnosed cognitive impairment
